function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Impact of COVID-19 restrictions on human movement and trade on habitats, with quantifiable data lacking.","Impact":"Potential decline in human movement reducing pressure on habitats but with unknown overall impact.","Mitigation":"Gathering quantifiable data on the impact of reduced human movement on habitats and ecosystems.","Technologies":"Remote sensing technologies for habitat monitoring.","People":"Conservation organizations, researchers, and environmentalists.","Owner":"Conservation organizations, research institutions, and government agencies."},{"Description":"Deterioration of stability leading to an increase in violence, illegal hunting, and illicit trade due to acute perturbations such as war or strife.","Impact":"Increased pressure on habitats and ecosystems, leading to damage and loss of biodiversity.","Mitigation":"Strengthening stability and security measures in affected areas to prevent illegal activities.","Technologies":"Satellite surveillance and monitoring technologies for detecting illegal activities.","People":"Communities in affected areas, conservation organizations, and government agencies.","Owner":"Government agencies, law enforcement, and international organizations."},{"Description":"COVID-related collapse of the international cashew market leading to food insecurity for farmers working in the Cantanhez National Park.","Impact":"Increased food insecurity and potential strain on local ecosystems due to changes in agricultural activities.","Mitigation":"Supporting alternative livelihoods for affected farmers and implementing sustainable agricultural practices.","Technologies":"Digital platforms for connecting farmers to new markets and sustainable agriculture technologies.","People":"Farmers in the Cantanhez National Park, local communities, and conservation organizations.","Owner":"Agricultural organizations, local governments, and conservation organizations."},{"Description":"Recognizing trade-offs in conservation research agendas due to reduced future spending and accelerating climate and biodiversity crises.","Impact":"Potential reduction in conservation efforts and inadequate response to climate and biodiversity crises.","Mitigation":"Prioritizing research and interventions based on critical conservation needs and long-term sustainability.","Technologies":"Data analytics for identifying critical conservation areas and predictive modeling for future biodiversity scenarios.","People":"Conservation researchers, environmental policymakers, and funding institutions.","Owner":"Funding institutions, research institutions, and conservation organizations."},{"Description":"Understanding human-nature interactions, including inter-species disease transmission pathways, and changes in motivations for seeking interactions with nature due to the pandemic.","Impact":"Lack of understanding of disease transmission risks and changes in human behavior impacting ecosystems and habitats.","Mitigation":"Conducting research on human-nature interactions and disease transmission pathways, along with education and awareness campaigns on responsible nature interaction.","Technologies":"Genomic sequencing for identifying disease transmission pathways and social media analytics for understanding changing human behaviors.","People":"Public health authorities, conservation organizations, and researchers.","Owner":"Research institutions, public health authorities, and environmental organizations."}]}
